creature.name: Ruzadoya Swiftmane
items: {@item +1 armor potency||+1} {@item resilient} duskwood {@item full plate}

attacks.name: guisarme
attacks.damage: {@damage 3d10+14} slashing plus {@damage 1d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed} plus rooting strikes

attacks.name: hoof
attacks.damage: {@damage 3d8+14} bludgeoning plus {@damage 1d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed} plus rooting strikes

mid.name: Grasping Armor
entries: A creature that {@action Strike||Strikes} Ruzadoya with a melee weapon must succeed at a DC 31 Reflex save or be disarmed of that weapon. If the creature critically fails, the weapon ends up in Ruzadoya's space. A creature that hits Ruzadoya with an {@trait unarmed} attack must succeed at a DC 31 Reflex save or become {@condition grabbed} by Ruzadoya until the end of her next turn, it {@action Escape||Escapes}, or Ruzadoya moves, whichever comes first.

mid.name: Rejuvenation
entries: When Ruzadoya is destroyed, her armor rebuilds her body over the course of {@dice 1d10} days. If her body is destroyed before then, the process restarts. Ruzadoya can only be permanently destroyed by obliterating her armor (such as with {@spell disintegrate|PC1}), transporting it to the {@place Plane of Fire|GMG}, or throwing it into the heart of a volcano.

mid.name: Sapping Aura
entries: 30 feet. When a creature in the aura uses a {@trait vitality} spell or ability, Ruzadoya automatically attempts to counteract it, with a {@d20 +23} counteract modifier.

bot.name: Graveknight's Curse
notes: This curse affects anyone who wears Ruzadoya's armor for at least 1 hour

stages.entry: {@condition doomed 1} and can't remove the armor
{@condition doomed 2}, âˆ’10-footstatus penalty to Speeds, and can't remove the armor
dies and transforms into the armor's graveknight

bot.name: Rooting Strikes
entries: On a critical hit with a melee weapon or {@trait unarmed} attack, Ruzadoya's target is {@condition immobilized} for 1 round ({@action Escape} DC 31) and {@condition clumsy||clumsy 1} for as long as the {@condition immobilized||immobilization} lasts.

bot.name: Ruinous Weapons
entries: Any weapon or {@trait unarmed} attack Ruzadoya uses gains the effects of the {@item +1 weapon potency||+1} {@item greater striking} and {@item wounding} weapon runes.

bot.name: Trample
entries: {@trait Medium} or smaller, hoof, DC 31

bot.name: Weapon Master
entries: Ruzadoya has access to the critical specialization effects of any weapons she wields.

bot.name: Withering Blast
entries: Ruzadoya unleashes a 30-foot cone of corruption. Creatures in the area take {@damage 8d12} void damage (DC 34 basic Fortitude save). Ruzadoya can use this ability once every {@dice 1d4} rounds.

items.name: Aura of Absorption
entries: 120 feet. Zibik constantly absorbs toxins and pathogens from his surroundings. Zibik automatically absorbs afflictions from non-creature plants, increasing his {@condition drained} value by 1 each round he absorbs any afflictions from such plants (with no maximum). Living creatures in the area can attempt a saving throw against any disease or poison afflicting them each round, increasing their degree of success for the save by one step. If a creature succeeds, Zibik automatically counteracts the affliction and increases his current {@condition drained} value by 1 (with no maximum). When Zibik removes an affliction with this ability, he automatically advances to Stage 1 of the affliction and must continue to attempt saving throws as normal. Zibik can choose to exclude any number of creatures in the area from this effect, and generally does so to absorb {@affliction Ayrzul's Blight|WoW3} while allowing natural afflictions to run their course.

items.name: Fungal Rebirth
entries: When Zibik dies as the result of a disease or his Aura of Absorption, fungus rebuilds his body over the course of {@dice 3d6} days. If his body is destroyed before then, the process restarts. When restored to life, he's bolstered by primal might; he gains a +3 circumstance bonus to saving throws against diseases for a number of weeks equal to the number of days it took his body to regrow, and he's unaffected by the {@condition drained} condition for the same duration (though he can still gain the condition).

items.name: Purge Plaguebearers
entries: Zibik exudes a cloud of spores in a 30-foot-radius emanation. They cling to all creatures currently afflicted with any disease in the area. Afflicted creatures take {@damage 25d6} void damage with a DC 48 basic Fortitude save. A creature that fails its save becomes {@condition doomed||doomed 1} for 1 minute and {@condition sickened||sickened 3}. Zibik can choose to exclude any number of creatures in the area from this effect. Zibik can't use Purge Plaguebearers again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

mid.name: Coppice Regrowth
entries: A phytohydra ordinarily has five heads. A creature can attempt to sever one of the heads by specifically targeting it and dealing damage equal to the head's Hit Points. A head that isn't completely severed returns to full Hit Points at the end of any creature's turn.

A phytohydra can regrow a severed head using phytohydra regeneration. A creature can prevent this regrowth by dealing fire damage to the stump, sealing it. Single-target {@trait fire} effects need to be targeted at a specific stump, but effects that deal splash damage or affect areas covering the hydra's whole space seal all stumps if they deal fire damage. If the attack that severs a head deals any fire damage or was dealt by an axe, the stump is sealed instantly. If all five heads are sealed, the phytohydra dies.

mid.name: Phytohydra Regeneration
entries: The phytohydra has regeneration equal to 5 Ã— the number of heads it has. If a phytohydra's body is missing any heads and the remaining stumps haven't been cauterized, the phytohydra attempts a DC 35 Fortitude save after it regains Hit Points from regeneration. On a success, one unsealed stump regrows two heads; on a critical success, two unsealed stumps regrow into two heads each. The phytohydra can never grow more than double the number of heads it ordinarily has. The phytohydra's regeneration only fully deactivates if all its heads are severed and all stumps are sealed, at which point it dies.

mid.name: Reactive Heads
entries: A phytohydra gains an extra reaction per round for each of its heads beyond the first, which it can use only to make {@action Reactive Strike|PC1|Reactive Strikes}. It can't use more than 1 reaction on the same triggering action, even if a creature leaves several squares within its reach, and the phytohydra must use a different head for each {@action Reactive Strike|PC1} it makes. Whenever one of the phytohydra's heads is severed, the phytohydra loses one of its extra reactions per round.

mid.name: Reactive Strike
entries: (see reactive heads)

bot.name: Focused Assault
entries: The phytohydra attacks a single target with its many heads. The phytohydra {@action Strike||Strikes} with its branches or its fangs. On a successful attack, the phytohydra deals damage from its branches or fangs {@action Strike} to the target, plus an additional {@dice 2d6} damage for every head it has beyond the first. On a failure (but not a critical failure), the phytohydra deals the damage from one branch or fangs {@action Strike} to the target creature. This {@action Strike} counts as a number of attacks equal to the number of heads the phytohydra has toward its multiple attack penalty.

bot.name: Splinter Breath
entries: The phytohydra spews splinters in a 60-foot cone that deals {@damage 4d6} piercing damage to all creatures in the area (DC 32 basic Reflex save). The damage increases by {@damage 2d6} for each head the phytohydra has. The phytohydra can't use Splinter Breath again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

bot.name: Storm of Branches
entries: The phytohydra makes a number of {@action Strike||Strikes} up to its number of heads, each against a different target. These attacks count toward the phytohydra's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after the phytohydra makes all its attacks.

top.name: Vine Sense
entries: The timberweb has imprecise tremorsense to detect the vibrations of creatures touching its spun vines.

bot.name: Rappel
entries: The timberweb moves straight down up to 60 feet on a spun vine. It can hang from the vine or drop off. The distance it descends doesn't count toward falling damage. A creature that successfully Strikes the vine (AC 36, Hardness 8, 30 HP) severs it, causing the timberweb to fall.

bot.name: Tree Tether
entries: A creature hit by the timberweb's vine {@action Strike} becomes entangled by the sticky fibers, taking a â€“15-foot penalty to its Speeds for 1 minute or until it {@action Escape||Escapes} (DC 34) or is cut free (AC 36, Hardness 8, 30 HP). If the target is adjacent to a wooden object of its size or larger, the target is instead {@condition immobilized} and stuck to that object until it {@action Escape||Escapes} or is cut free.

top.name: Shaped Tongue
entries: The speaker in spores can speak with all plants and the creature they resemble.

top.name: Spore Matrix
entries: 60 feet. The speaker in spores is surrounded by a strong concentration of spores. The speaker can communicate telepathically to any creatures in the aura who have breathed in their spores. This communication always uses the listener's native language and can't be used with any creature that doesn't breathe.

top.name: Sporesight
entries: The speaker in spores can see through spores drifting in the air, ignoring cover. This is an imprecise sense and functions only in areas without strong wind currents. Sporesight doesn't function underwater.

mid.name: Blight Walker
entries: The speaker in spores recovers from the {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition slowed}, and {@condition stunned} conditions at the end of their turn. They're also immune to penalties to their Speeds and ignore cover, concealment, difficult terrain, and greater difficult terrain resulting from plants or fungi.

mid.name: Toxic Spores
mid.trigger: A creature critically hits the speaker or the speaker dies
entries: The blighted speaker in spores releases a burst of toxic spores. Any creature within 10 feet of the speaker in spores takes {@damage 3d6} poison damage (DC 31 basic Fortitude save). Creatures that fail their saving throw are exposed to {@affliction Ayrzul's Blight|WoW3}.

top.name: Blight Sense
entries: A gritblight can detect the location of nearby creatures afflicted with {@affliction Ayrzul's Blight|WoW3} as a precise sense at the listed range.

top.name: Grit Vision
entries: A gritblight's vision is unaffected by clouds of sand, dirt, grit, or other earth materials in air or water.

mid.name: Blight Cloud
entries: 30 feet. A gritblight continually sheds tiny fragments of radioactive earth in a cloud around it. This cloud conceals the gritblight as a light fog and sheds dim light in the area. Any creature that begins its turn in the aura takes {@damage 2d6} poison damage with a DC 30 basic Fortitude save. A creature that fails its save is exposed to {@affliction Ayrzul's Blight|WoW3} and a creature that critically fails is additionally {@condition sickened||sickened 1}.

bot.name: Ayrzul's Blight
entries: See {@affliction Ayrzul's Blight|WoW3}, but DC 33.

bot.name: Earth Glide
entries: The gritblight can {@action Burrow} through any earthen matter, including rock. When it does so, the gritblight moves at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing.

bot.name: Labyrinthine Vision
entries: The gritblight forces disorienting visions of {@deity Ayrzul|LOGM|Ayrzul's} Blistering Labyrinth into the minds of nearby creatures. All creatures in a 60-foot cone take {@damage 7d12} mental damage with a DC 33 Will save. Creatures {@condition blinded} by a gritblight's Labyrinthine Vision see only endless earthen tunnels in every direction. The gritblight can't use this ability again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

Failure: The creature takes full damage and is {@condition blinded} for 1 minute.
Critical Failure: The creature takes double damage and is {@condition blinded} permanently.

bot.name: Trample
entries: {@trait Medium} or smaller, claw, DC 33

mid.name: Verdant Burst
entries: When a leshy mob's Hit Points reach a threshold that would reduce its size, a burst of primal energy explodes from the fallen leshies and empowers the surviving fighters. The leshy mob gains {@dice 4d8} temporary Hit Points that last for 10 minutes. In addition, all squares within 5 feet of the troop become filled with various plants, becoming difficult terrain. If the environment is not a viable environment for these plants, they wither after 24 hours.

bot.name: Change Shape
entries: The leshies can transform into an assortment of Small plants that fills a 15-foot burst centered on any one square the leshy mob occupies, creating difficult terrain. When the leshies return to their natural form, they {@ability Form Up|B3} anywhere within the burst. This otherwise uses the effects of one with plants.

bot.name: One with the Foliage
entries: The leshy mob ignores difficult terrain caused by plants and fungi, and it treats greater difficult terrain from such sources as difficult terrain.

bot.name: Rain of Seeds
entries: The leshies grab and hurl an assortment of stones, spores, and explosive seeds, launching a ranged attack in the form of a volley. This volley is a 10-foot burst within 60 feet that deals {@damage 4d8} bludgeoning or poison damage (DC 30 basic Reflex save). When the leshies are reduced to 8 or fewer squares, this area decreases to a 5-foot burst.

bot.name: Troop Movement
entries: Whenever the leshy mob {@action Stride||Strides}, it first {@ability Form Up|B3|Forms Up} as a free action to condense into a 20-foot-by-20-foot area (minus any missing squares), then moves up to its Speed. This works just like a {@trait Gargantuan} creature moving; for instance, if any square of the mob enters difficult terrain, the extra movement cost applies to the whole group.

bot.name: Veggielante Justice
entries: The leshies assault each enemy creature within 5 feet, with a DC 30 basic Reflex save. The damage depends on the number of actions.
{@as 1} {@damage 3d8} bludgeoning or slashing damage
{@as 2} {@damage 3d8+11} bludgeoning or slashing damage
{@as 3} {@damage 3d8+16} bludgeoning or slashing damage

resistances.name: +2 status to all saves vs. {@trait fear}

mid.name: Verdant Burst
entries: When a redwood leshy dies, a burst of primal energy explodes from their body, restoring {@dice 5d8} Hit Points to each {@trait plant} creature in a 30-foot emanation. This area is filled with saplings, becoming difficult terrain. If the environment isn't a viable environment for these trees, they wither after 24 hours.

bot.name: Change Shape
entries: The redwood leshy can take the form of a {@trait Large} tree, using the effects of one with plants.

bot.name: Looming Strike
entries: The leshy deals an additional {@dice 1d8} damage to creatures smaller than it.

bot.name: Needles That Catch the Clouds
entries: The leshy can cast {@spell create water|PC1}, {@spell downpour|PC1}, and {@spell mist|PC1} as innate {@trait primal} spells once per day, but only while {@trait Large} or larger.

top.name: Wood Scent
entries: A spitting sawfly can smell plants and wood as a precise scent at the listed range.

bot.name: Consume Essence
bot.requirements: The spitting sawfly is adjacent to any creature with the {@trait wood} trait or to a {@creature coiled conifer|WoW3}
entries: The sawfly feasts upon the targeted creature or the {@creature coiled conifer|WoW3|coiled conifer's} sap, regaining {@dice 5d6} Hit Points. A targeted creature must attempt a DC 29 Fortitude save or become {@condition drained||drained 1} ({@condition drained||drained 2} on a critical failure).

bot.name: Creeping Sprout
entries: A creature afflicted with creeping sprout is treated by the spitting sawfly as if it has the {@trait wood} trait

stages.entry: {@damage 12d6} acid damage, {@creature creeping cone swarm|WoW3} emerges

bot.name: Plant Spores
entries: The spitting sawfly plants spores in an adjacent creature that's {@condition paralyzed} or {@condition unconscious}, exposing it to creeping sprout disease.

mid.name: Blight Burst
mid.trigger: The creeping cone swarm is reduced to fewer than half its Hit Points or is reduced to 0 Hit Points
entries: A 15-foot-radius emanation of acid explodes from the creeping cone swarm. Creatures in the area take {@damage 3d12} acid damage (DC 25 basic Reflex save). Non-blight bonded creatures damaged by this effect are exposed to {@affliction Ayrzul's Blight|WoW3}.

mid.name: Putrid Spores
entries: 30 feet. A creature entering the aura must succeed at a DC 26 Fortitude save or become {@condition sickened||sickened 1} until the end of its turn ({@condition sickened||sickened 2} on a critical failure). While within the aura, an affected creature takes a â€“2 circumstance penalty to recover from the {@condition sickened} condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

bot.name: Jagged Scales
entries: The creeping cones shake off a barrage of jagged, stony scales. Each creature in a 10-foot burst within 30 feet of the swarm takes {@damage 2d12+7} slashing damage (DC 29 basic Reflex save).

bot.name: Pummeling Lurches
entries: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes {@damage 6d6} bludgeoning damage (DC 29 basic Fortitude save). A creature that fails its save falls {@condition prone}.

mid.name: Regurgitate Sap
mid.trigger: A creature {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} by the coiled conifer attempts to {@action Escape}
entries: Sticky, caustic sap wells up in the conifer's maw. The DC of the {@action Escape} check increases by 2, and the creature takes {@damage 3d12} acid damage (DC 33 basic Reflex save).

bot.name: Greater Constrict
entries: {@damage 2d10+9} bludgeoning, DC 33

bot.name: Sap Spray
entries: The coiled conifer spews bile-like sap in a 60-foot cone. Creatures in the area take {@damage 7d12} acid damage (DC 33 basic Reflex save) and become {@condition sickened||sickened 1} ({@condition sickened||sickened 2} on a critical failure). The coiled conifer can't use this ability again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

bot.name: Slithering Roots
bot.requirements: The coiled conifer has at least one creature {@condition grabbed}
entries: The coiled conifer {@action Stride||Strides} up to its full Speed, taking any creatures it has {@condition grabbed} with it.

bot.name: Swallow Whole
entries: Large, {@damage 3d6+9} bludgeoning, Rupture 24

attacks.name: stalk
attacks.damage: {@damage 2d8+9} piercing plus {@damage 2d6} acid and {@ability Improved Grab}

mid.name: Quick Capture
mid.trigger: A creature hits or touches the reborn devotee
entries: The reborn devotee makes a stalk {@action Strike} against the triggering creature. If it hits, the creature is {@condition grabbed} in that stalk.

bot.name: Focused Assault
entries: The reborn devotee attacks a single target with four stalks, making one stalk {@action Strike}. On a success, the reborn devotee deals the damage from one stalk {@action Strike} plus an additional {@dice 1d8} damage for every stalk beyond the first. On a failure, the reborn devotee deals the damage from one stalk {@action Strike}, but it can't use Improved Grab. It deals no damage on a critical failure. This counts toward the reborn devotee's multiple attack penalty as a number of attacks equal to the number of stalks the devotee has.

bot.name: Hungry Flurry
entries: The reborn devotee makes four stalk Strikes at a â€“2 penalty, each against a different target. These attacks count toward the reborn devotee's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after it makes all its attacks.

bot.name: Swallow Whole
entries: Large, {@damage 2d8+5} bludgeoning plus {@damage 2d6} acid, Rupture 17

resistances.name: all damage
resistances.note: except force, {@item ghost touch}, {@trait spirit}, or {@trait vitality}; double resistance vs. non-{@trait magical}

bot.name: Frightful Moan
entries: The ghost laments its fate, forcing each living creature within 30 feet to attempt a DC 33 Will save. On a failure, any creature becomes {@condition frightened||frightened 2} (or {@condition frightened||frightened 3} on a critical failure). On a success, any creature is temporarily immune to this ghost's Frightful Moan for 1 minute.

bot.name: Memory of Leaves
entries: The ghost mourns its verdant birthplace, creating a swirling cloud of phantom leaves as a 20-foot emanation until the end of its next turn. All creatures within the emanation become {@condition concealed}, and all creatures outside the emanation become {@condition concealed} to creatures within it. Creatures with the {@trait plant} or {@trait wood} traits ignore this concealment. The ghost can't use Memory of Leaves again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

mid.name: Blighted Cloak
mid.trigger: A creature adjacent to the Bonebleacher bugbear hits them with a melee {@action Strike}
entries: The triggering creature is exposed to {@affliction Ayrzul's Blight|WoW3}. The bugbear can't use Blighted Cloak again until they spend 10 minutes applying blighted plant matter to their cloak.

bot.name: Pinpoint Poisoner
entries: When the Bonebleacher bugbear successfully {@action Strike||Strikes} an {@condition off-guard|PC1} creature with a poisoned weapon or exposes an {@condition off-guard|PC1} creature to an {@trait inhaled} poison, the creature takes a âˆ’2 circumstance penalty to its initial save against that poison.

bot.name: Poison Spray
bot.requirements: The Bonebleacher bugbear is holding a {@trait contact} or {@trait injury} poison
entries: The Bonebleacher bugbear attaches the poison container to a nozzle on their mask, which then sprays the poison from the mask in a 15-foot cone. The bugbear isn't exposed to the poison. All creatures in the cone are immediately exposed to the poison, and each creature must attempt a Fortitude save against the poison.

bot.name: Sneak Attack
entries: The Bonebleacher bugbear deals an additional {@damage 2d6} precision damage to {@condition off-guard|PC1} creatures.

bot.name: Twin Feint
bot.requirements: The Bonebleacher bugbear is wielding two melee weapons, each in a different hand
entries: The Bonebleacher bugbear makes a dazzling series of attacks with two weapons, using the first attack to throw their foe off-guard against a second attack at a different angle. They make one {@action Strike} with each of their two melee weapons, both against the same target. The target is automatically {@condition off-guard|PC1} against the second attack. Apply the bugbear's multiple attack penalty to the {@action Strike||Strikes} normally.

resistances.name: all damage
resistances.note: except force, {@item ghost touch}, {@trait spirit}, or {@trait vitality}; double resistance vs. non-{@trait magical}

bot.name: Corrupting Gaze
entries: The ghost stares at a creature it can see within 30 feet. The target takes {@damage 6d6} void damage with a DC 30 basic Will save. A creature that fails its save is also {@condition stupefied||stupefied 1} for 1 minute.

stages.entry: {@damage 5d6} mental damage and {@condition clumsy||clumsy 1}, plus the creature takes a âˆ’2 penalty to saving throws against {@affliction Ayrzul's Blight|WoW3} for 24 hours

mid.name: Reactive Strike
entries: Bristles only. The woodweave caterpillar gains an extra reaction at the start of each of its turns that it can use only to make a {@action Reactive Strike|PC1}. It can't use more than one {@action Reactive Strike|PC1} triggered by the same action. In addition to the normal trigger, the caterpillar can make a {@action Reactive Strike|PC1} against a creature that touches it or an adjacent creature that attempts a melee {@action Strike} against it.

bot.name: Penetrating Bristles
entries: On a critical hit with a bristles {@action Strike}, a woodweave caterpillar's bristles lodge in the target's body, causing severe pain and blood loss. They deal {@damage 3d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage}, and the target is {@condition off-guard|PC1} as long as the {@condition persistent damage} continues.

bot.name: Trample
entries: Medium or smaller, foot, DC 32

attacks.name: scamp
attacks.damage: {@damage 4d6+10} piercing plus 4 {@condition persistent damage||persistent piercing damage} and 4 poison {@trait splash} damage

mid.name: Abeyance Rift
entries: If Old Thornbarker dies unexpectedly before passing on their knowledge in a succession ritual, the amassed lore within his roots and boughs explodes out in a shock wave that deals {@damage 8d10} mental damage to creatures within 30 feet (DC 32 basic Will save) before dissipating; those who fail also fall {@condition prone}.

mid.name: Sycophantic Scamps
entries: See below.

bot.name: Memory Maelstrom
entries: Old Thornbarker tries to overwhelm foes with a surge of information he has absorbed over his long life. This surge deals {@damage 5d6} mental damage to each enemy within 40 feet, who must attempt a DC 32 Will save.

Critical Success: The creature maintains its composure, takes no damage, and is temporarily immune to Memory Maelstrom for 1 minute.
Success: The creature is {@condition stunned||stunned 1} and takes half damage.
Failure: The creature takes full damage and is {@condition stunned||stunned 3}.
Critical Failure: The creature takes double damage, is {@condition confused} for {@dice 2d4} rounds, and is {@condition stunned||stunned 3}.

bot.name: Sycophantic Scamps
entries: Dozens of {@creature wood scamp|RoE|wood scamps} clamber on, nest in, and flit around Old Thornbarker, feeding him their observations and gossip. The arboreal can grab a nearby scamp as if drawing a weapon, using it as a thrown weapon. The unlucky scamp impacts with a clatter of spines and toxic pollen, after which the dazed elemental scampers away to regain its senses.

If Old Thornbarker takes 40 or more damage from an area effect, the scamps scatter and seek cover for {@dice 1d6} rounds, during which time Old Thornbarker can't make scamp {@action Strike||Strikes} and loses {@ability all-around vision}.

mid.name: Aura of Decay
entries: 30 feet. {@trait Plant} objects and creatures in the emanation can't regain Hit Points unless the effect that attempts to heal them counteracts the aura, which has a counteract rank of 6 and a counteract DC of 32. A primal warden of Zibik can spend 1 action to reverse this aura; it becomes an aura of renewal with the {@trait healing} trait, instead doubling the number of Hit Points of any {@trait healing} effect received by a {@trait plant} creature in the emanation.

mid.name: Rotten Burst
mid.trigger: The primal warden of Zibik takes physical damage
entries: A chunk of rotten bark bursts from the warden's body at its attacker. The warden makes a rotten bark {@action Strike} against an adjacent creature without triggering reactions.

mid.name: Primal Destruction
entries: When the primal warden of Zibik is reduced to 0 Hit Points, it erupts with primal energy in a 30-foot emanation, dealing {@damage 12d6} void damage. Each creature in the area must attempt a DC 32 Will save with the following outcomes.

Failure: The creature takes full damage and becomes temporarily cursed by Zibik to be {@condition enfeebled||enfeebled 1} and {@condition stupefied||stupefied 1} for 1 day; this is a {@trait curse} effect with a counteract DC of 32.
Critical Failure: As failure, except the creature becomes {@condition enfeebled||enfeebled 2} and {@condition stupefied||stupefied 2}.

bot.name: Flourishing Growth
entries: The first time each round any creature takes damage from the warden's fists, the target must attempt a DC 32 Fortitude save. On a failure, tiny sprouts burst from the creature's flesh, and it becomes {@condition slowed||slowed 1} for 1 round.

bot.name: Fractal Rot
entries: The first time each round any creature takes damage from the warden's rotten bark, the target becomes {@condition sickened||sickened 1} as the flesh where it was struck momentarily twists and rots, causing considerable pain.

items.name: Primal Toll
entries: The primal mantis takes {@damage 2d6} mental damage whenever it casts a {@trait primal} innate spell.

items.name: Collective Swarm
entries: The rancorous druids collectively transform into a swarm of Tiny insects. They cast {@spell swarm form|LOGM} heightened to 6th rank, but the duration is 1 hour instead of 5 minutes.

top.name: Forager
entries: While using {@skill Survival} to {@action Subsist}, if the sentry rolls a failure or a critical failure, they get a success instead. If the sentry rolls a success, they can provide food for 16 additional creatures that eat about as much as a human, or 32 creatures on a critical success.

top.name: Forest Walker
entries: The sentry ignores the effects of difficult terrain from a forest environment. They can {@action Sneak} through underbrush without the need to attempt a {@skill Stealth} check as long as the sentry moves no more than 5 feet at a time and isn't within 10 feet of an enemy at any point during their movement.

mid.name: Sentry's Warning
mid.trigger: The sentry is about to roll {@skill Perception} or {@skill Survival} to determine their initiative
entries: The sentry visually or audibly warns allies, granting them a +1 circumstance bonus to their initiative rolls. Depending on how the sentry warns allies, this action has the {@trait auditory} or {@trait visual} trait.

bot.name: Hunt Prey
entries: The sentry designates a single creature they can see and hear, or one they're Tracking, as their prey. The sentry gains a +2 circumstance bonus to {@skill Perception} checks to {@action Seek} the prey and to {@skill Survival} checks to {@action Track} the prey. The first time the sentry hits the designated prey in a round, they deal an additional {@damage 1d8} precision damage. The sentry also ignores the penalty for making ranged attacks within their second range increment against the prey they're hunting. These effects last until the sentry uses {@action Hunt Prey} again.

bot.name: Protector of Arenway
entries: The sentry can only cast its primal innate spells while on the Isle of Arenway.

top.name: Rooted
entries: A rootridden is bonded to a specific root network. If it's more than 300 feet from this network for at least 1 minute, it becomes {@condition sickened||sickened 2} until it's again within 300 feet of the root network for at least 1 minute.

top.name: Walk the Roots
entries: The rootridden ignores the effects of difficult terrain caused by plants and fungi.

mid.name: Root Spawn
entries: A living creature slain by a rootridden that had a lower level than the rootridden rises as a new rootridden after {@dice 1d10} rounds, on its turn. This new rootridden is under the command of the rootridden that created it. If the creator is destroyed, any rootridden it created in the past 24 hours are destroyed as well, immediately collapsing into inert plant matter.

resistances.name: all
resistances.note: except {@trait force}, {@item ghost touch|PC1}, {@trait spirit}, or {@trait vitality}; double resistance vs. non-magical

attacks.name: caustic touch
attacks.damage: {@damage 2d8} void plus {@damage 1d8} acid plus drain life

mid.name: Aggravating Aura
entries: 10 feet. Acidic vapor surrounds the caustic wraith, making other creatures' bodies feel raw and especially sensitive to pain. A creature that begins in the area must succeed at a DC 28 Will save or gain weakness 3 to all damage for 1 round (weakness 5 on a critical failure).

bot.name: Dissolve From the Inside
entries: The caustic wraith reaches into the body of a creature within 10 feet, melting its organs and inflicting pain. The target takes {@damage 4d8} acid damage with a DC 28 basic Fortitude save. On a critical failure, the creature is also {@condition sickened||sickened 2}.

bot.name: Drain Life
entries: When the caustic wraith damages a living creature with its caustic touch {@action Strike}, the wraith gains 10 temporary Hit Points, and the target must succeed at a DC 28 Fortitude save or become {@condition drained||drained 1}. Further damage dealt by the caustic wraith increases the {@condition drained} condition value by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of {@condition drained||drained 4}.

bot.name: Wraith Spawn
entries: A living humanoid slain by a caustic wraith rises as a wraith spawn after {@dice 1d4} rounds. This wraith spawn is under the command of the wraith that killed it. It doesn't have drain life or wraith spawn and becomes {@condition clumsy||clumsy 2}. After 24 hours, the wraith spawn dissipates and is destroyed.

bot.name: Drowning Hook
bot.requirements: A creature is {@condition prone} within Druulbach's reach
entries: Druulbach uses his sickle to push the creature down as water bubbles up below it. The target becomes submerged in water until they are no longer {@condition prone} and must hold their breath (Player Core 437) if it can't breathe water. The target takes {@damage 6d6} bludgeoning damage (DC 29 basic Fortitude save) and loses 3 rounds worth of air if it fails the save.

bot.name: Flurry of Hooks
entries: Druulbach makes three sickle Strikes against one target. If multiple attacks hit, combine their damage and apply weaknesses and resistances only once.

bot.name: Serrated Takedown
bot.requirements: Druulbach hit with a sickle {@action Strike} on his most recent action this turn
entries: Druulbach drags down the target, knocking it {@condition prone} and dealing {@damage 3d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage} to the creature.

bot.name: Balanced
entries: Blades Druulbach's multiple attack penalty with agile weapons and agile unarmed attacks is âˆ’3 for his second attack and âˆ’6 for subsequent attacks (rather than âˆ’4 and âˆ’8).
